results.overview: When the renegade crew of Serenity agrees to hide a fugitive on their ship, they find themselves in an action-packed battle between the relentless military might of a totalitarian regime who will destroy anything – or anyone – to get the girl back and the bloodthirsty creatures who roam the uncharted areas of space. But... the greatest danger of all may be on their ship.
results.title: Serenity

results.overview: The quiet life of Baker Dill, a fishing boat captain who lives on the isolated Plymouth Island, where he spends his days obsessed with capturing an elusive tuna while fighting his personal demons, is interrupted when someone from his past comes to him searching for help.
results.title: Serenity

results.overview: A sadean "huit clos". Originally inspired by Octave Mirbeau's Garden of Torture. A banquet organized by a lord (Hervé de Luze) and his companion (Anne Angel), turns into an orgy and the forced marriage of two guests. Happiness in crime, hence the title of the film. The film was shot with real blood and animal skulls.
results.title: Serenity!

results.overview: A funny, heartbreaking, and most of all animated autobiographical gem-- 'Serenity' seamlessly weaves together themes of young love, hate sex, addiction, death, existential angst, and even pizza-- all under five minutes. Both entertaining and insightful, this short is refreshingly honest, original, and brave.
results.title: Serenity

results.overview: Originally edited in two versions. Version I, 70 minutes; version II, 90 minutes. (The only known existing version is not Markopoulos’s edit and contains additional titles, music and voice-over added later than 1961. 65 minutes.) Filmed in Mytilene and Annavysos, Greece, 1958. Existing copy on video, J. and M. Paris Films, Athens.
results.title: Serenity

results.overview: Serenity lets you escape into the relaxing world of nature with spectacular scenery of crashing ocean surf, panoramic sunsets, blossoming flowers, cascading waterfalls, underwater wonderlands, rushing mountain streams and more! "Serenity's" deeply relaxing original musical soundtracks and the actual sounds of nature will transport you to your own personal paradise.
results.title: Moodtapes: Moments - Serenity

results.overview: A film made during a short workshop. It is not easy for a traveler to remain calm when a fellow passenger on a train invades his space.
results.title: Serenity Now

results.overview: 8.40 minutes, 2019 vimeo.com/313908830
results.title: Neo Serenity

results.overview: Undisturbed for over 20 years, this remote forested island in the Pacific Northwest is visited by a group of campers on horseback. The camp tranquility is broken by violence and terror.
results.title: Serenity Farm

results.overview: Be transported into a dreamland of seascapes and ocean moods with Serenity: Southern Seas captured in High Definition by Emmy Award-winning filmmaker David Hannan and set to a beautiful soundtrack composed by Terry Oldfield, one of the world's masters of music for relaxation. It's as refreshing as a summer's breeze. Decorate your home or office with Serenity's spellbinding seascapes. Fall asleep and wake up to mesmerizing music, breathtaking sunsets and sunrises, and golden beaches. Lose yourself on spectacular coasts, dappled by dawn light and washed by azure seas. Let the stress float away with the waves.
results.title: Serenity - Southern Seas

results.overview: Get ready to view some of the most gorgeous tulips you've ever seen. Enjoy 40 photographs that display and change every 30 seconds, while listening to relaxing cinema/classical music. If you have toddlers, this would be a great way to play the "What color is that tulip?" game. If you're studying, need something to play in the background before a bridal shower, or just want something soothing to watch before you go to sleep, this may be what you're looking for. This video is a great way to wind down little ones before bedtime. Enjoy!
results.title: Serenity Channel - Tulips

results.overview: Enjoy 40 minutes of Florida coastline, from Ft. Meyers all the way up to Destin, Florida. The first 20 minutes contain smooth jazz music; the last 20 minutes you will hear natural sounds of the waves crashing on the beach. Enjoy!
results.title: Serenity Channel - Florida

results.overview: Enjoy watching colorful fish as they swim around your television screen. Great for studying, relaxing, or even as a sleep aid. Classical and relaxing background music blend harmoniously with this digital aquarium. This relaxation nature video will make you feel as if you are right there looking through the glass!
results.title: Serenity Channel - Aquariums

results.overview: After the death of his mother, a man and his father take a cruise together to try mending their relationship.
results.title: Empress of Serenity

results.overview: The rain clears up, rays of sunshine peak through, and flowers start to bloom. Spring – it has arrived, and it is beautiful. Spring is a time for new beginnings, and after a particularly harsh winter in lockdown, spring offers a new hopeful outlook on life.  This documentary explores the journey from the dreadful winter into the freedom of spring. While finding joy in the little things, we start to embrace the new life not only affiliated with the season of spring, but also our new beginnings as a society.
results.title: Sunshine And Serenity

results.overview: Get ready to view some of the most amazing pictures that were created naturally from the caves in Antelope Valley. This area is on Navajo land, and to some of the older Navajos, entering this place was similar to entering a cathedral. Enjoy watching 30 minutes of vibrant photographs being displayed one after the other. In some of the pictures, the twist and turns of the walls make out interesting objects. We found eleven: a chief, laughing bear, mask, python, screaming bear, lioness, singing worm, Egyptian cobra, wolf, and a man in the moon. See if you can find them and others.
results.title: Serenity Channel - Antelope Valley

results.overview: A documentary aired on The Sci Fi Channel about the movie Serenity (2005) and the fandom of Firefly (2002), the series that it was based on. Features interviews with the cast and crew.
results.title: Sci Fi Inside: 'Serenity'

results.overview: Featuring soothing sights and melodic sounds, this relaxing video whisks viewers away to the rich underwater world of the Caribbean, the Red Sea and the Indian Ocean for a glimpse into a spectacular aquatic universe. You'll find yourself in healing waters as you marvel at brilliantly colored coral outcroppings, a host of exotic marine creatures and vibrant plant life ... all from the comfort of your armchair.
results.title: Nature States - Sea of Serenity

results.original_title: Serenity at Sea: John Ford and the Araner
results.overview: This 13 minute documentary short is found on the DVD : "The Long Voyage Home" (1940), directed by John Ford and starring John Wayne. The Araner was Admiral Ford's personal vessel and home away from home.
results.title: Serenity at Sea: John Ford and the Araner

results.overview: Iwane Sakazaki returns to his homeland and gets caught in the middle of an incident that results in the tragic death of two of his best friends from childhood. He decides to leave his domain, parting with his fiancée Nao, and becomes a vagrant masterless samurai with nothing more to lose. Iwane drifts to Edo, filleting eels during the day and working as a bodyguard at night for Imazuya, a reputable money exchanger. He gradually wins the trust of the people around him because of his mellow nature, the chivalrous way he treats everyone with courtesy, and his skills of swords. One day, he learns that Imazuya is being targeted in a conspiracy to sabotage a new monetary system implemented by the government, and Iwane decides to protect the people who have given him support.
results.title: Iwane: Sword of Serenity
